alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 17 at 6:55AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Camden, east central Pasquotank, and Currituck Counties, the eastern City of Chesapeake and the City of Virginia Beach through 730 AM EDT... At 654 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Northwest to near Indiantown to near Old Trap. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Currituck, Grandy, Kempsville, Regent University, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Princess Anne, Shiloh, Back Bay, Indiantown, Corolla, Old Trap, Whitehall Shores, Northwest, Moyock, Knotts Island, Rudee Heights, Poplar Branch and Pungo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
